import numpy as np # linear algebra

import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.36cd7bb2:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
source.b15b0fce:
#Males and females 
sns.catplot(x= "Sex", kind= "count", data=df, palette= "husl")
source.1fa7902c:
#Place of embarkation
sns.catplot(x= "Embarked", kind= "count", data=df, palette="Paired")
source.45a0bd90:
#Number of people for each class 
sns.catplot(x= "Pclass", kind= "count", data=df, palette= "cubehelix")
source.f5b4e2e4:
#Number of siblings / spouses on aboard  
sns.catplot(x="SibSp", kind="count", data=df, palette= "mako")
source.f9900bf3:
#Survivors and non-survivors 
sns.catplot(x="Survived", kind="count", data=df, palette= "rocket")
source.3be8281c:
#Number of parents / children on aboard 
sns.catplot(x="Parch", kind="count", data=df)
source.9935b67b:
#Male & women survival difference: In general, more females survived than male passangers 
sns.catplot(x="Survived", kind="count",hue="Sex",data=df, palette="rocket")
source.d3dd6d79:
#Class difference survival rate: Most passangers who had the low class ticket could not survive the accident 
sns.catplot(x="Pclass", kind= "count", hue="Survived", data=df)
source.7b043f28:
#Place of embarkation and sex 
sns.catplot(x="Embarked", kind="count", hue="Sex", data=df, palette="husl")
source.b1da3953:
#Place of embarkation and survival rate
sns.catplot(x="Embarked", kind="count",hue="Survived",data=df, palette="pastel")
source.4663e46a:
#Place of embarkation and class: Most passangers took the ship from Southampton and among them most of the passangers had the lowest class ticket (class3)
sns.catplot(x="Embarked", kind="count",hue="Pclass",data=df, palette="Set2")
source.ed10d0c7:
#Ticket fare distribution  
plt.figure(figsize=(9,6))
sns.distplot(df.Fare, color= "gray").set_title("Ticket fare")
source.9b484133:
plt.figure(figsize=(9,5))
sns.histplot(df.Age, color= "pink").set_title("Age distribution of the passangers")
source.e52deaa8:
custom_palette= ["black"]
sns.set_palette(custom_palette)
sns.scatterplot(x="Age", y="Fare", data=df).set_title("Age & Fare", fontsize= 30)
source.c3a27bf9:
#Relationship between age of passengers and ticket fare 
custom_palette2= ["gray"]
sns.set_palette(custom_palette2)
sns.lmplot(x="Age", y="Fare", data=df)
